text.料理の音に敏感で、ついそばだててしまう: They pick up on any sound \nof cooking.
text.走る事を考えてると、たまに何も聞いてない: They tune out everything \nwhen she's thinking about \nrunning.
text.称賛と会長の声は絶対に聴き逃さない: They always pay attention \nto what the Student \nCouncil President says.
text.ユーロビートを聴くとかっ飛ばしたくなる: Listening to Eurobeat \nmakes her want to \ndrive faster.
text.歓声の中でも故郷の人の声は聞き分けられる: I can hear the voices of \npeople back home, \ncheering for me.
text.突然他人の耳を塞ぎ『だ～れだ？』と尋ねる:
She loves suddenly 
covering another person's 
ears and asking "Guess 
who?".
text.触れられると異様に照れるらしい: She get's really shy when \nsomeone touches them.
text.パーティーと聞けばどこへでも駆けつける: Whenever she hears about \na party, she runs to it.
text.お茶を点てる時は微動だにしない: They don't move an inch \nwhen she's making tea.
text.人前ではツンと立ててしまいがち: They tend to stand alert \nin front of others.
text.カウントを聴くと身構えてしまう: She gets defensive \nwhen she hears the \nwrestling count.
text.どんな言葉も賞賛に聞こえる: Every word sounds like \npraise to her.
text.ファンファーレを聞くと血が滾る: Hearing a fanfare makes \nher blood boil.
text.ダジャレを思いつくと、ピクンと大きく動く: Her ears prick up when \nshe hears a good pun.
text.花の世話をする時は優しくかすかに垂れる: They droop gently when \ntending to flowers.
text.エモの波動をキャッチすると毛が逆立つ: Catching emo vibes makes \nher ears stand on edge.
text.時折、意味深にピンと立っている: When they stand on edge, \nit's meaningful.
text.『安売り』、『セール』と聞くとピンと立つ: When she hears the word \n"bargain" or "sale," her \nears stand up straight.
text.庶民文化の話題には興味津々: They love hearing about \nnew, popular, culture.
text.幼い頃は物音に敏感で、よく驚いていた:
As a child, she was 
sensitive to noises 
and was often startled 
by them.
text.耳抜きがとても上手: She doesn't listen to \nthings that she doesn't \nwant to hear.
text.彼女にだけ聞こえる声があるらしい: Apparently there \nis a voice that only \nshe can hear.
text.眠っていても命令が耳に入ると即座に起きる: She wakes up instantly \nwhen commanded, even when \nshe's in a deep sleep.
text.少女漫画を読んでいる時はくるくるよく動く: They twitch around \na lot when she's reading \nshoujo manga.
text.どんなに微かな空腹音も必ずキャッチする: They always catch the \nslightest sound of hunger.
text.他人の不幸な話を聞くとしゅんと垂れる: They droop when she hears \nabout other's unhappiness.
text.小さい子の声につい反応してしまう: They tend to react to the \nsound of little \nchildren's voices.
text.耳やおでこを触れられることは断固拒否する: She refuses to be touched \non the ears or forehead.
text.お姉ちゃんという声に、ついピクっと動く: They twitch to voices \nthat sound like an \nolder sister.
text.祭りばやしの音を聞くと、踊るように動く:
When they hear the sound 
of festival music, they 
move as if they were 
performing a dance.
text.親友曰く『耳の動きすら鬱陶しい』: According to her best \nfriend, "Even her ear \nmovement is depressing".
text.メトロノームの音を聞くと癒される: Listening to the sound of \na metronome soothes her.
text.手招きするように動いたら、甘えたい時: When they move like \nbeckoning hands, she \nwants to be pampered.
text.ウマ娘の中で最もティアラの似合う耳と自負:
She's proud to admit that 
among all other horse 
girls, her ears look the 
best with a tiara.
text.目覚まし時計に勝ちたいとは思っている: They'd like to break the \nalarm clock.
text.人の話は半分くらいしか聞こえていない: She only hears half of \nwhat people are saying.
text.新しいいたずらを思いつくとぴこぴこする: They ping back and forth \nwhen she thinks of a new \nprank
text.知らない単語はすべて呪文に聞こえる: Every word she doesn't \nknow sounds like an \nincantation.
text.耳かきをするのは得意だが、されるのは苦手: She's good at cleaning \nother's ears, but not \ngetting her ears cleaned.
text.ファンの声は1人残らず拾う: They pick up on every \nsingle fan's voice.
text.物語の山場になるとピンと反り返る: When the story reaches \nits climax, it flicks and \nturns everywhere.
text.両耳を畳んで写真撮影するのを流行らせたい:
In order to make them 
seem fashionable, she 
takes pictures with both 
ears folded down.
text.帽子の耳用の穴は、自分で切って縫った: She added the ear-holes \nin her beanie herself.
text.気になる話題には耳だけ向ける: They only turn towards \ntopics that interest her.
text.さわると安心感に包まれ、癒されると評判: They have a reputation \nfor being healing and \ncomforting when touched.
text.難しい言葉は右から入って左から流れ出る: Hard words go in \nthe right and come \nout the left.
text.ハチマキを外すと垂れる: They droop down when her \nbeanie is taken off.
text.たまに方位占いに使う: She will sometimes use \nthem to point while \nfortune-telling.
text.足で耳に触ることができる: Can touch her ears with her feet
text.男性の声を聞くと固まってしまう: She freezes up when she \nhears men's voices.
text.ネーチャンと聞くとつい反応してしまう: They tend to react when \nshe hears the word \n"nee-chan".
text.一流にふさわしい話題以外耳に入れたくない:
They don't want to hear 
anything other than 
topics adequate for the 
first-class.
text.周りが騒がしくても聞き流せる: Will pay no attention to \nnoisy environments.
text.風向きと風の強さを感知できる: They can sense wind \ndirection and wind \nstrength.
text.追い詰められるほど、嬉しそうにピクつく: Twitch ever more happily \nthe more she's ran down
text.音感に優れている: She has an excellent \nsense of sound.
text.いい格言が思い浮かぶとピクンと震える: When she thinks of a good \nproverb, her ears tingle.
text.ガラスの割れる音がすると耳を伏せてしまう: The sound of breaking \nglass makes her ears tilt \ndownwards.
text.可愛い声を聞くとほんのり赤くなる: She blushes a little when \nshe hears a pretty voice.
text.耳かきされると、すぐ眠ってしまう: Falls asleep easily while \ngetting her ears cleaned.
text.ラッパの音が聞こえるとピンと背筋が伸びる: Stand up when hearing \nthe sound of a horn
text.自分と似た耳のウマ娘は目で追ってしまう: Twitch ever more happily the \nfurther she's cornered
text.音楽が聞こえると耳を澄ますこともある: Can stand straight and attentive \nwhen listening to music
text.イヤリングをよくなくし、今ので9代目: Often loses earrings, \nthis is her 9th set
text.両耳のカバーはパパの手作り: Both of her ear covers \nwere handmade by her dad.
text.メンコは絶対つけ忘れない: Never forgets to wear \nher ear covers
text.ゴングの音に反応してしまう: Always respond to the \nsound of a gong
